.
Nonresident Aliens Without SSNs
Many nonresident aliens do not have SSNs, and VA does not require them to obtain one.Â  Accordingly, it is unnecessary to request an SSN (or a certified statement indicating that no SSN has been assigned or requested) for an individual who
has no SSN
is not a U.S. citizen, and
resides outside
the U.S.
the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico
the Virgin Islands
American Samoa
Guam, or
the Northern Marianas.
